author: Catherine Lucey
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Catherine Lucey looks at what came out of the trade talks with China this week. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s China Trade Framework Mostly a Reset to Earlier Terms

author: Erik Wasson, Ken Tran
description: The US House approved $9.4 billion in Elon Musk’s DOGE federal spending cuts, with Republican moderates swallowing their concerns about cutting previously approved spending for foreign aid and public broadcasting.
title: House Passes Musk’s DOGE Cuts to PBS, NPR and Foreign Aid

author: Anika Arora Seth
description: Lawyers for Harvard University urged a federal judge to ensure that the Trump administration won’t impose alternative restrictions on the school’s enrollment of foreign students after the government’s earlier efforts were blocked.
title: Harvard Asks Judge to Bolster Block of Foreign Student Ban

author: Joe Deaux, Jenny Leonard, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration is developing a plan to use Cold War-era powers to prioritize and fund rare earth projects it deems critical to national security, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Mulls Using Defense Powers to Fund Rare-Earth Projects

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Argentina’s monthly inflation slowed to the lowest level since the height of the pandemic, scoring a major victory for President Javier Milei ahead of a crucial midterm vote.
title: Argentina Inflation Hits Lowest Since Covid in Win for Milei

author: Anika Arora Seth
description: A Russian scientist at Harvard University was freed on bail by a federal judge after spending four months in detention for failing to declare biological material she brought into the US for research.
title: Russian Harvard Scientist Freed on Bail After Months in Custody

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: The International Monetary Fund is seeing signs that the rise in trade and activity to front-run US President Donald Trump’s tariffs is beginning to unwind as the global economy still faces heightened uncertainty.
title: IMF Sees Unwinding of Global Trade Surge Ahead of Trump Tariffs

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: US Senator Alex Padilla of California was forcibly removed from a press conference and handcuffed as he tried to confront Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem while she briefed reporters on a federal immigration crackdown in Los Angeles.
title: California Senator Handcuffed Outside Noem Briefing in LA

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott said he opposes swift action on a proposal from Texas’ Ted Cruz that would bar the Federal Reserve from paying interest on reserves to banks to help pay for President Donald Trump’s tax and spending package.
title: Key Senator Opposes Plan to Halt Fed Interest Payments to Banks

author: Andrew Kreighbaum
description: Immigrants admitted to the US from a Biden-era parole program for Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua, and Venezuela have begun receiving notices of termination urging them to depart the US.
title: Trump Administration Orders 500,000 Immigrants to Leave US

author: Chaimae Chouiekh
description: Canadians continue to support retaliating against US President Donald Trump’s wave of tariffs, but their fervor has waned as the trade war wears on.
title: Canadian Support for Counter-Tariffs Dips as Trump Trade War Persists

author: Catherine Lucey, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump is hailing the latest trade framework with China as a game-changing breakthrough. Yet the deal he touted Wednesday represents little more than a reset back to earlier terms — and even that came at a cost.
title: For Trump, Resolving US-China Trade Fight Comes at a Cost

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italy selected its envoy to NATO to take over as US ambassador, seeking to maintain friendly ties with Washington as President Donald Trump upends global trade.
title: Italy Picks NATO Envoy as US Ambassador to Manage Trump Ties

author: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga
description: Telefonica SA said it wants to ramp up investments in defense as military budgets swell across Europe.
title: Telefonica Looking to Boost Defense Investments, Murtra Says

author: Naureen S Malik
description: Big data centers connecting to power grids is now one of the greatest near-term risks to reliability, according to a rare warning by the US agency charged with overseeing the sector.
title: Data Centers Pose Threat to Electric Grids, Says US Regulator

author: David Herbling
description: East African finance chiefs increased planned spending to a record to sustain economic growth and mitigate the effects of geopolitical risks and cuts in foreign aid.
title: East Africa Plans Spending Boost to Offset Global Risk, Aid Cuts

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: A group of six bipartisan lawmakers plan to introduce a bill that would repeal sanctions on Syria, giving a boost to White House efforts to lift restrictions on the country after the fall of President Bashar Al-Assad.
title: Bipartisan House Bill Aims to Lift Assad-Era Sanctions on Syria

author: Zoe Tillman, Emily Birnbaum
description: President Donald Trump and his allies are pursuing an alternative strategy to defend against mounting court orders blocking his policies: Raise the financial stakes for those suing the administration.
title: Trump Wants to Make It More Expensive to Sue Over His Policies

author: Kate Sullivan, Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump said Israel “could very well” strike Iran but that he had advised against an attack while negotiations were ongoing, as the departure of US staff from the region fans concerns about a coming assault.
title: Trump Sees Chance of ‘Massive Conflict’ Between Israel and Iran

author: Anna Edgerton
description: Republicans have long cast themselves as the defenders of state power and opponents of a strong central government — but don’t always act that way when it’s a Republican president trying to bend states to his will. Now, with Donald Trump testing the limits of presidential reach, Democratic governors such as California’s Gavin Newsom are the ones asserting states’ authority.
title: What Powers Do US States Have to Resist Trump?

author: Mario Parker, Stephanie Lai
description: US President Donald Trump expressed his condolences after the deadly crash of a Boeing Co. 787 Dreamliner operated by Air India that left hundreds dead, saying he had offered “pointers” on possible causes as well as an offer of assistance to Indian authorities.
title: Trump Says He Offered Assistance to India After Boeing Crash

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: California said the Trump administration’s deployment of the National Guard and US Marines to respond to protests in Los Angeles was illegal and cannot continue “unchecked.”
title: California Asks Judge to Limit ‘Unchecked’ Use of Trump Troops

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Trump Administration sued New York over a law that restricts federal immigration authorities from making arrests at state courthouses, ratcheting up tensions over enforcement actions against undocumented immigrants that have sparked protests across the country.
title: Trump DOJ Sues NY Over Law Blocking ICE Arrests at Courthouses

author: Josh Wingrove, Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump said the US government will retain a “golden share” in United States Steel Corp. after its purchase by Japan’s Nippon Steel Corp.
title: Trump Says US Government Will Get ‘Golden Share’ in US Steel

author: Keith Laing, Mario Parker
description: President Donald Trump said he may raise US auto tariffs in order to boost domestic auto manufacturing, a move that could further ratchet up tensions with trading partners.
title: Trump Floats Higher Auto Tariff, Guts California Gas-Car Ban

author: Julie Fine
description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott is deploying 5,000 National Guard soldiers and 2,000 state troopers to assist local law enforcement during planned protests this weekend.
title: Texas Deploys 5,000 National Guard Soldiers Ahead of Protests

author: Thomas Gualtieri, Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez dismissed calls for an early election and vowed to clean up his party after a top aide quit over graft allegations.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Vows to See Out Term After Party Graft Report

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The US wants Rwanda and Democratic Republic of Congo to sign a peace deal by July, according to a top State Department official for Africa.
title: US Seeks a Peace Deal in Rwanda-Congo Conflict by July

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump said Thursday he did not plan to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, days after saying he would “soon” pick his nominee to lead the central bank next.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Fire Powell, But Again Demands Rate Cut

author: Raphael Almeida, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo
description: The leader of Brazil’s lower house of Congress signaled that lawmakers may strike down a proposal from President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to raise taxes, casting doubt on the government’s latest plan to help meet its fiscal goals.
title: Brazil House Speaker Signals Opposition to New Lula Fiscal Plan

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s government said it will give Transnet SOC Ltd. additional guarantees so the troubled state ports and freight railway operator can settle all its debt that falls due and execute its capital-investment program.
title: South Africa to Give Transnet More Guarantees to Settle Debt

author: Ethan Bronner, Galit Altstein
description: As the US moves personnel out of key spots in the Middle East under threat from Iranian strikes, reports by American media say Israel is stepping up plans to attack the Islamic Republic’s nuclear facilities.
title: Here’s How an Israel Strike on Iran Nuclear Sites Could Play Out

author: Joel Leon
description: The US stock market is back on track and within spitting distance of February’s all-time highs. Yet corporate executives are dumping shares at the fastest clip since November.
title: Corporate Insiders Use Rally to Dump Shares at Fastest Pace Since US Election

author: Lucy White
description: UK Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds said he was hopeful that a deal can be struck soon with the US to lower tariffs on British automobiles but indicated that negotiations over steel have further to go.
title: UK Trade Secretary Reynolds Hopeful of US Deal on Car Tariffs Soon

author: Mathieu Dion, Erik Hertzberg
description: A Canadian government program that aims to minimize layoffs by providing benefits to workers who agree to work fewer hours has seen its uptake double in about half a year.
title: Canada Firms Flock to Government Program to Avoid Layoffs Amid Tariffs

author: Catherine Lucey, Debby Wu
description: A senior Trump administration official projected that Huawei Technologies Co.’s output of its Ascend AI chip will be at or below 200,000 for 2025, responding to US lawmakers’ concerns that China is gaining ground in production of advanced semiconductors.
title: US Says Huawei’s 2025 Output No More Than 200,000 AI Chips

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez’s senior adviser, Santos Cerdán, resigned Thursday after a court asked him to testify voluntarily over bribery and influence peddling allegations.
title: Top Aide to Spanish PM Sanchez Resigns Amid Graft Allegations

author: Andra Timu, Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO plans to bolster its missile-defense systems as part of an effort to shield the alliance’s eastern flank from attack, a move likely to stoke tensions with Russia.
title: NATO to Boost Missile Defenses in East to Counter Russian Threat

author: Mathieu Dion, Josh Wingrove
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he hopes to secure a commercial and security agreement soon with US President Donald Trump, though he tamped down expectations that a deal will be ready in time for the Group of Seven summit in a few days.
title: Carney Sees Progress in Trade Talks Between US and Canada

author: Nacha Cattan
description: President Donald Trump signaled changes will be made to US immigration policy to address worker shortages as his crackdown on migrants hurts businesses.
title: Trump Says His Deportation Drive Is Sparking Worry Over Jobs

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: Trade officials from India and the US have hardened their stance on some key issues as they race to conclude an interim deal before higher US tariffs take effect in July, people familiar with the matter said.
title: India, US Harden Stance in Trade Talks as July Deadline Looms

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano, Max Ramsay
description: Italy will need a decade to meet NATO’s planned defense spending target of 5% of GDP, Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said on Thursday, as the alliance debates how quickly it can achieve the steepest military ramp-up since the Cold War.
title: Italy Seeks More Time to Reach NATO’s New Defense Spending Goal

author: Paul Vecchiatto, Antony Sguazzin
description: South Africa, struggling to reset relations with the US, is willing to give way on so-called phytosanitary requirements for poultry-meat imports, but fears an impasse with its second-biggest trading partner over pork shipments.
title: South Africa Sees Scope to Ease Farm-Trade Dispute With US

author: Andrea Palasciano, Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania accused Russian importers of using medical sanctions exemptions to receive goods for the use of Moscow’s military, its deputy foreign minister said.
title: Russia Uses Medical Exemption to Evade Sanctions, Lithuania Says

author: Eltaf Najafizada, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India described a potential meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Canadian counterpart on the sidelines of the upcoming Group of Seven summit as an “important opportunity” to mend bilateral ties, signaling Modi is likely to attend the summit next week.
title: India Signals Modi Likely to Attend G-7 Summit in Canada

author: David Herbling
description: Kenyan police used teargas to disperse demonstrators in the nation’s capital Nairobi on Thursday, as Treasury Secretary John Mbadi was set to unveil the 2025-26 budget.
title: Kenyan Police Disperse Protesters as Government Presents Budget

author: Colum Murphy
description: While Donald Trump hailed the outcome of trade talks in London, Xi Jinping walked away with an understated strategic gain: a negotiating process that buys China time and helps defuse the threat of more harmful tariffs and technology curbs.
title: Xi Plays Long Game on US-China Trade as Trump Seeks Quick Wins

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Russia has likely suffered 1 million causalities since the start of its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the UK Ministry of Defence said, a staggering human cost from the war with no end in sight.
title: UK Says Russian War Casualities in Ukraine Climb to 1 Million

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: China plans to remove tariffs on all imports from almost all African countries, expanding an arrangement that previously covered only those deemed the least developed as Beijing seeks to strengthen economic ties with more partners amid a trade war with the US.
title: China to Extend Duty-Free Market Access to 53 African Nations

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: A wave of terror attacks across Colombia is stirring fears of regression to the dark days of the 1990s, when cocaine cartels and guerrillas made the Andean nation the most violent on Earth.
title: Bomb Blasts, Assassination Plot Plunge Colombia Back Into Terror

author: Michael Cohen
description: The number of people who have died in floods in South Africa’s Eastern Cape province has risen to 57 and includes several school children, who drowned when the minibus taxi they were traveling in was swamped.
title: South Africa Says Death Toll From Flooding Rises to 57

author: Rebecca Choong Wilkins
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China Scores a Week of Wins in Its US Standoff

author: Loren Grush
description: The White House’s spending plans would further the space agency’s evolution toward becoming an incubator for private industry
title: Trump Plan to Kill Dozens of NASA Missions Threatens US Space Supremacy

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Britain is turning into a “national health state” with half of all day-to-day public service spending set to be allocated to health and social care by the end of the decade, the Resolution Foundation think tank said.
title: Surging Health-Care Costs Set to Eat Up Half of the UK’s Budget

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO is expanding its satellite surveillance capacities to scan large swaths of land, enabling the alliance to monitor military movements in Ukraine and on Russia’s borders with its eastern members, top commander Pierre Vandier said.
title: NATO Gets New Tools to Monitor Ukraine and the Eastern Flank

author: Joe Deaux
description: Rare earths are among the most critical raw materials on the planet, deeply embedded in the technologies that underpin modern life. Yet few people have heard of them or know what they do.
title: Why Rare Earths Are China’s Trump Card in Trade War With US

author: Ben Westcott, Anthony Capaccio
description: The Trump administration has launched a review into the Aukus defense pact that the US signed with Australia and the UK in 2021 to counter China’s military expansion in the Indo-Pacific region.
title: What’s at Stake If Trump Scraps Security Pact With UK, Australia

author: Fares Alghoul, Galit Altstein
description: Five Palestinian aid workers were killed and several injured when a bus they were traveling in was attacked by Hamas militants in central Gaza, a foundation backed by the US and Israel said.
title: Gaza Aid Foundation Says Five Workers Killed in Hamas Attack

author: Jonathan Tirone, Patrick Sykes
description: Iran said it would build a new uranium-enrichment center in response to a decision by the United Nations atomic watchdog to censure the Islamic Republic over its nuclear program, deepening a crisis that’s also drawn in the US and Israel.
title: Iran Plans New Nuclear Enrichment Site After UN Watchdog Censure

author: Desire Nimubona
description: Burundi’s ruling party won all 108 seats in the national assembly following an election.
title: Burundi Ruling Party Wins All Seats in National Assembly

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Britain’s goods exports to the US fell in April by the largest amount for any month since records began in 1997 after President Donald Trump launched his global trade war.
title: Trump Tariffs Prompt Largest-Ever Drop in UK Goods Exports to US

author: Ben Sills
description: The US State Department congratulated Russia on its national holiday for the first time since the start of the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine and reaffirmed that Washington will remain engaged in efforts to end the war.
title: US Marks Russia Holiday for First Time Since Invasion of Ukraine

author: Galit Altstein
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government survived an attempt by opposition parties to dissolve parliament early Thursday, as tensions spiked over Iran’s nuclear program.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu Dodges Early Election as Iran Tensions Rise

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s economy is headed for its worst performance since the pandemic as the strife-torn country reels from the impact of a devastating earthquake in March that’s estimated to have caused $11 billion in damage, according to the World Bank.
title: Myanmar Recovery Dented by Devastating Quake, World Bank Says

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin this month in his first visit to Russia since taking office.
title: Indonesia Leader to Meet Putin in Russia to Boost Ties

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said he won’t rush into a trade deal with the US that would hurt the nation’s interests, although he’d welcome any progress made before an expected summit with US President Donald Trump.
title: Japan Won’t Rush Trade Deal, While Welcoming Progress Before G-7

author: Slav Okov
description: People are growing more concerned about the potential impact on prices.
title: Bulgarians Are Getting the Euro, But Half of Them Don’t Want It

author: Krystof Chamonikolas, Kriti Gupta
description: Czech President Petr Pavel called on the US to give Europe more time and realistic goals to take care of the continent’s security and contain an increasingly aggressive Russia.
title: Czech Leader Calls on Trump to Give Europe More Time to Rearm

author: Daedo Kim, Sangmi Cha
description: South Korea’s presidential election last week has sparked the biggest equity surge in more than four years. Options traders are betting there’s more to come.
title: Korean Stock Hedges Cheapen With $3.2 Billion of Bullish Bets

author: Swati Pandey
description: Trade tensions between the U.S. and China are unlikely to ease soon despite a recent thaw on tariffs, according to Gene Sperling of Pacific Investment Management Co., who warns market volatility is likely to persist.
title: Sperling Sees Enduring US-China Trade Tensions, Volatility Ahead

author: Ari Natter
description: The sale of millions of acres of federal land would provide billions of dollars to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive package of tax cuts and spending in the Senate’s version of the bill released Wednesday night.
title: Millions of Acres of Public Land Sales Added to Trump’s Tax Bill

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: President Donald Trump remains open to communications with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, the White House said in its latest comments expressing willingness to resume dialogue with the nuclear-armed North, despite no visible signal from Kim seeking engagement.
title: Trump Open to Correspondence With Kim Jong Un, White House Says

author: Adam Haigh
description: Oaktree Capital Management LP co-founder Howard Marks said investors should expect uncertainty to endure under US President Donald Trump and relatively high valuations in global markets require a cautious stance.
title: Oaktree’s Marks Says Trump Values Unpredictability, Be Cautious

author: Yihui Xie
description: Gold gained for a second day on increased tensions in the Middle East, with its haven status also supported by President Donald Trump’s comments that he will inform trading partners on tariff rates within two weeks.
title: Gold Advances on Middle East Tensions and Trump’s Tariff Pledge
